medical_history.chief_complaint: Sub-acute onset of gait ataxia, dysphagia, and dysarthria.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced worsening stepping gait for the previous decade. EMG examination showed a demyelinating sensorimotor neuropathy a year and a half before presentation. Neurologic examination revealed ataxia that worsened after eye closure, upper limb incoordination, and gaze-evoked nystagmus. He developed bilateral loss of visual acuity one month after admission.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic progressive-relapsing inflammatory demyelinating CNS disease; EMG showed mixed axonal-demyelinating polyneuropathy.
medical_history.family_history: A brother showed stepping gait with bilateral severe deficit of ankle dorsiflexion and, to a lesser degree, plantar flexion; genetic analysis showed the same mutation of GJB1 gene.
